revised_title: Rainbow over Woolsthorpe Manor: A Photographic Tribute to Newton's Theory
tldr: This article shares a remarkable photograph of a rainbow over Woolsthorpe Manor, the birthplace of Sir Isaac Newton. The rainbow, featuring primary and secondary bows, was captured by Professor Roy L. Bishop in 1979. The photograph serves as a tribute to Newton's work on the rainbow and his theory of colors. The article also provides an extract from Newton's Opticks, discussing the scientific explanation of the rainbow phenomenon.
